availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Franklin George (Ballard Co. Farmer/Graves Co. merchant)

body.p: Farmer and merchant in Ballard and Graves Counties, Kentucky. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth George. Father of Sarah George, Norvil George, Eddy George, and Quintus George. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850. Merchant in Graves County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 261A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 52.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 33.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Milburn, District 7, p. 19.
